scraped_data.title: Home - Chicopee Country Club
scraped_data.address: Chicopee Country Club  | 1290 Burnett Road, Chicopee, MA 01020 | 413-594-9295
scraped_data.allText: Welcome to Chicopee Country Club “Top 10 Course in Massachusetts “ Hope you all had a great holiday season! Chicopee Country Club is closed for the winter months. If you need to inquire about a gift card, 2024 league play or would like information on holding a golf event, please feel free to email Mike at moneill@chicopeema.gov. UPCOMING EVENTS Chicopee Country Club’s 60th Anniversary Golf Tournament Saturday, July 19th Four-person Scramble 12:30 Shotgun Start $60 per golfer to include: Golf, cart, tee gift, food and prizes Open Two Ball Sunday, July 13th 18 Holes – Gross & Net Two Divisions (combined handicap) 0 – 20 21 & Up 8 stroke maximum handicap differential Entry Fee – $120 team Includes Green Fee Please call pro shop for more information or to sign up (413)594-9295 Mail payment to: Chicopee Country Club 1290 Burnett Road Chicopee, MA 01020 Or email: Mike O’Neill – moneill@chicopeema.gov for more information. COVID Single Rider Cart Policy During the 2020 COVID Season we experienced negative effects on the golf course and on our golf carts due to the single cart usage such as course traffic damage, extra work and time for staff including cleaning and disinfecting each cart and simple wear and tear on the carts. Due to those reasons we will be adjusting our cart fees for those players that feel uncomfortable sharing a cart. We respect your decision to ride alone, however, there will be a “Single Rider Cart Rate” charge. Disability Blue Flag Policy Chicopee Country Club offers the use of disability flags on golf carts for those individuals who provide written medical reasons. The disabled golfer must possess a doctor’s letter verifying that you are in need of a handicap flag to play golf or a State Issued Disabled Persons Parking Identification Placard. The Director of Golf has the right to allow use of a disability flag to any individual that may need special consideration. Flag privileges may be suspended or revoked with or without warning for abuse of this policy. Rules for Blue Flags 1. The disability cart may be driven up to within (30 feet) of a green or tee box. 2. At NO TIME should a disability cart be parked or driven on a green, collar or between a green and bunker adjacent to the green or a tee box. 3. No carts are allowed in the 18th tee box area. 4. In the case of inclement weather or certain golf course conditions, carts may be restricted to cart paths only. NO DISIBILITY PRIVILEGE will be extended at that time. 5. The Ranger/ Starter have absolute authority for all traffic control. If a player refuses to abide by the rules of the day (as stated above), his/her disability flag privileges may be suspended after review by the Director/ Commission. Gift cards are available! Gift Cards are available for any amount you’d like! For more information, call Our Pro Shop at (413)594-9295. Open Two Ball Sunday, May 18th 18 Holes – Gross & Net Two Divisions (combined handicap) 0 – 20 21 & Up 8 stroke maximum handicap differential Entry Fee – $120 team Includes Green Fee *Season Pass Holders – $25* Tee Times – Make your own foursome

scraped_data.title: About Us - Chicopee Country Club
scraped_data.address: Chicopee Country Club  | 1290 Burnett Road, Chicopee, MA 01020 | 413-594-9295
scraped_data.allText: Learn more about Chicopee Country Club Visit one mighty fine municipal course Chicopee Country Club with its rolling terrain, tree-lined fairway and fast, sloping greens is generally regarded as a fine championship course by area golfers. Through the years, this picturesque golf course has received accolades from publications such as Golf Digest, USA Today, and the New England Journal of Golf magazines. It has been touted as being among the best public courses in Massachusetts or being named as one of New England’s top 100 golf courses, or being among those courses that provide the best value in Massachusetts. Happy Spring! The snow is melting, but we still need frost to come out of the ground and the course to dry out before we can get machines out to do a Spring Clean-up. With some help from Mother Nature, we could be opening by the first week of April. Please continue to check back with us as we will do our best to get the course open for all to enjoy! PGA Golf Professional Mike O’Neill Head Golf Course Superintendent Mike Bach, IGM Golf Commissioners: Chairman – Gary Laperle Vice Chairman – Tom Robak Gary Lonczak Glenn Laplante Rick Nadeau

About Us

Learn more about Chicopee Country Club

Visit one mighty fine municipal course

Chicopee Country Club with its rolling terrain, tree-lined fairway and fast, sloping greens is generally regarded as a fine championship course by area golfers. Through the years, this picturesque golf course has received accolades from publications such as Golf Digest, USA Today, and the New England Journal of Golf magazines.

It has been touted as being among the best public courses in Massachusetts or being named as one of New England’s top 100 golf courses, or being among those courses that provide the best value in Massachusetts.

Happy Spring! The snow is melting, but we still need frost to come out of the ground and the course to dry out before we can get machines out to do a Spring Clean-up. With some help from Mother Nature, we could be opening by the first week of April. Please continue to check back with us as we will do our best to get the course open for all to enjoy!

PGA Golf Professional

Mike O’Neill

Head Golf Course Superintendent

Mike Bach, IGM

Golf Commissioners:

Chairman – Gary Laperle
Vice Chairman – Tom Robak
Gary Lonczak
Glenn Laplante
Rick Nadeau

Download more information below

Instruction

Instruction

If you’re looking to start the game or just sharpen your skills, golf instructions are available and can be made by calling the pro shop (413)594-9295. Lessons can be made by appointment and can be given individually or in groups. Look for Women and Junior Clinics throughout the year.
Ladies Clinic
  • May 5th, 12th & 19th
  • 5:30 to 6:30 pm
  • $40 for all 3 sessions

Click Here to Print/Download Application

Please fill out and return attached application to:

Chicopee Country Club
1290 Burnett Rd.
Chicopee, MA 01020

content.full_text: Welcome to Chicopee Country Club “Top 10 Course in Massachusetts “ Hope you all had a great holiday season! Chicopee Country Club is closed for the winter months. If you need to inquire about a gift card, 2024 league play or would like information on holding a golf event, please feel free to email Mike at moneill@chicopeema.gov. UPCOMING EVENTS Chicopee Country Club’s 60th Anniversary Golf Tournament Saturday, July 19th Four-person Scramble 12:30 Shotgun Start $60 per golfer to include: Golf, cart, tee gift, food and prizes Open Two Ball Sunday, July 13th 18 Holes – Gross & Net Two Divisions (combined handicap) 0 – 20 21 & Up 8 stroke maximum handicap differential Entry Fee – $120 team Includes Green Fee Please call pro shop for more information or to sign up (413)594-9295 Mail payment to: Chicopee Country Club 1290 Burnett Road Chicopee, MA 01020 Or email: Mike O’Neill – moneill@chicopeema.gov for more information. COVID Single Rider Cart Policy During the 2020 COVID Season we experienced negative effects on the golf course and on our golf carts due to the single cart usage such as course traffic damage, extra work and time for staff including cleaning and disinfecting each cart and simple wear and tear on the carts. Due to those reasons we will be adjusting our cart fees for those players that feel uncomfortable sharing a cart. We respect your decision to ride alone, however, there will be a “Single Rider Cart Rate” charge. Disability Blue Flag Policy Chicopee Country Club offers the use of disability flags on golf carts for those individuals who provide written medical reasons. The disabled golfer must possess a doctor’s letter verifying that you are in need of a handicap flag to play golf or a State Issued Disabled Persons Parking Identification Placard. The Director of Golf has the right to allow use of a disability flag to any individual that may need special consideration. Flag privileges may be suspended or revoked with or without warning for abuse of this policy. Rules for Blue Flags 1. The disability cart may be driven up to within (30 feet) of a green or tee box. 2. At NO TIME should a disability cart be parked or driven on a green, collar or between a green and bunker adjacent to the green or a tee box. 3. No carts are allowed in the 18th tee box area. 4. In the case of inclement weather or certain golf course conditions, carts may be restricted to cart paths only. NO DISIBILITY PRIVILEGE will be extended at that time. 5. The Ranger/ Starter have absolute authority for all traffic control. If a player refuses to abide by the rules of the day (as stated above), his/her disability flag privileges may be suspended after review by the Director/ Commission. Gift cards are available! Gift Cards are available for any amount you’d like! For more information, call Our Pro Shop at (413)594-9295. Open Two Ball Sunday, May 18th 18 Holes – Gross & Net Two Divisions (combined handicap) 0 – 20 21 & Up 8 stroke maximum handicap differential Entry Fee – $120 team Includes Green Fee *Season Pass Holders – $25* Tee Times – Make your own foursome

content.full_text: Learn more about Chicopee Country Club Visit one mighty fine municipal course Chicopee Country Club with its rolling terrain, tree-lined fairway and fast, sloping greens is generally regarded as a fine championship course by area golfers. Through the years, this picturesque golf course has received accolades from publications such as Golf Digest, USA Today, and the New England Journal of Golf magazines. It has been touted as being among the best public courses in Massachusetts or being named as one of New England’s top 100 golf courses, or being among those courses that provide the best value in Massachusetts. Happy Spring! The snow is melting, but we still need frost to come out of the ground and the course to dry out before we can get machines out to do a Spring Clean-up. With some help from Mother Nature, we could be opening by the first week of April. Please continue to check back with us as we will do our best to get the course open for all to enjoy! PGA Golf Professional Mike O’Neill Head Golf Course Superintendent Mike Bach, IGM Golf Commissioners: Chairman – Gary Laperle Vice Chairman – Tom Robak Gary Lonczak Glenn Laplante Rick Nadeau
headings: Learn more about Chicopee Country Club

content.full_text: Instruction If you’re looking to start the game or just sharpen your skills, golf instructions are available and can be made by calling the pro shop (413)594-9295. Lessons can be made by appointment and can be given individually or in groups. Look for Women and Junior Clinics throughout the year. Ladies Clinic - May 5th, 12th & 19th - 5:30 to 6:30 pm - $40 for all 3 sessions Click Here to Print/Download Application Please fill out and return attached application to: Chicopee Country Club 1290 Burnett Rd. Chicopee, MA 01020 1290 Burnett Rd. Chicopee, MA 01020

Please remember to let us know what dates they will be coming. July 14th, 15th & 16th Or August 18th, 19th & 20st Time: 8:30 to 11:00 am. Golf Instructions by PGA Golf Professional Mike O’Neill & Staff Entry Fee: $85 Chicopee Residents each camp $95 Non- residents each camp Ages 8 – 16 (Includes 3 days of instruction, contests, lunch & golf pack)

Just one visit to the Chicopee Country Club and you will understand why the course attracts golfers from all over Massachusetts, northern Connecticut, eastern New York, and southern Vermont.

value: Welcome to Chicopee Country Club “Top 10 Course in Massachusetts “ Hope you all had a great holiday season! Chicopee Country Club is closed for the winter months. If you need to inquire about a gift card, 2024 league play or would like information on holding a golf event, please feel free to email Mike at moneill@chicopeema.gov. UPCOMING EVENTS Chicopee Country Club’s 60th Anniversary Golf Tournament Saturday, July 19th Four-person Scramble 12:30 Shotgun Start $60 per golfer to include: Golf, cart, tee gift, food and prizes Open Two Ball Sunday, July 13th 18 Holes – Gross & Net Two Divisions (combined handicap) 0 – 20 21 & Up 8 stroke maximum handicap differential Entry Fee – $120 team Includes Green Fee Please call pro shop for more information or to sign up (413)594-9295 Mail payment to: Chicopee Country Club 1290 Burnett Road Chicopee, MA 01020 Or email: Mike O’Neill – moneill@chicopeema.gov for more information. COVID Single Rider Cart Policy During the 2020 COVID Season we experienced negative effects on the golf course and on our golf carts due to the single cart usage such as course traffic damage, extra work and time for staff including cleaning and disinfecting each cart and simple wear and tear on the carts. Due to those reasons we will be adjusting our cart fees for those players that feel uncomfortable sharing a cart. We respect your decision to ride alone, however, there will be a “Single Rider Cart Rate” charge. Disability Blue Flag Policy Chicopee Country Club offers the use of disability flags on golf carts for those individuals who provide written medical reasons. The disabled golfer must possess a doctor’s letter verifying that you are in need of a handicap flag to play golf or a State Issued Disabled Persons Parking Identification Placard. The Director of Golf has the right to allow use of a disability flag to any individual that may need special consideration. Flag privileges may be suspended or revoked with or without warning for abuse of this policy. Rules for Blue Flags 1. The disability cart may be driven up to within (30 feet) of a green or tee box. 2. At NO TIME should a disability cart be parked or driven on a green, collar or between a green and bunker adjacent to the green or a tee box. 3. No carts are allowed in the 18th tee box area. 4. In the case of inclement weather or certain golf course conditions, carts may be restricted to cart paths only. NO DISIBILITY PRIVILEGE will be extended at that time. 5. The Ranger/ Starter have absolute authority for all traffic control. If a player refuses to abide by the rules of the day (as stated above), his/her disability flag privileges may be suspended after review by the Director/ Commission. Gift cards are available! Gift Cards are available for any amount you’d like! For more information, call Our Pro Shop at (413)594-9295. Open Two Ball Sunday, May 18th 18 Holes – Gross & Net Two Divisions (combined handicap) 0 – 20 21 & Up 8 stroke maximum handicap differential Entry Fee – $120 team Includes Green Fee *Season Pass Holders – $25* Tee Times – Make your own foursome

value: Chicopee Country Club is regarded as a fine championship course by area golfers. It has received accolades from publications such as Golf Digest, USA Today, and the New England Journal of Golf magazines.
One of New England’s Top 100 Golf Courses

course_policies.value: COVID Single Rider Cart Policy: Due to the single cart usage during the 2020 COVID Season, there will be a “Single Rider Cart Rate” charge for those who feel uncomfortable sharing a cart. Disability Blue Flag Policy: The use of disability flags on golf carts is available for individuals with written medical reasons. The disabled golfer must possess a doctor’s letter verifying the need for a handicap flag or a State Issued Disabled Persons Parking Identification Placard. The Director of Golf has the right to allow use of a disability flag to any individual that may need special consideration. Flag privileges may be suspended or revoked for abuse of this policy.
